name: Ratatouille Sheet Pan Pizza
description: Pizza is our favourite way to get our servings of veggies! This recipe offers a medley of vibrant vegetables, rich tomato sauce, and ooey gooey cheese, all on a crispy crust. Skip the veg prep if you have leftover Ratatouille already on hand (see Tip).

ingredients.name: Ratatouille Seasoning or Chicken Souvlaki Seasoning

preparation: Position rack in bottom of oven. Preheat oven to 450° F. Lightly oil two 1⁄4 Sheet Pans.
Divide dough in half and roll out each ball on a lightly floured surface to fit pans. Place dough in pans and press to fill edges.
Thinly slice tomatoes, pepper, zucchini, eggplant, and onion. Pat dry with paper towel to absorb excess moisture.
Spread sauce over doughs. Arrange veggies over sauce. Sprinkle with seasoning and cheese.
Bake 18–22 min, or until crust is golden. Add additional toppings, if desired. Cut into squares and serve.
tips: FYI: one recipe of Ratatouille makes 4–5 cups, depending how large you chop up your veg. Use at least at least 3 cups to top your ‘zas.
perfectlyBalanceYourPlate: After cooking, top each pizza with 1 cup cooked, cubed chicken breast and 1 diced avocado.

products.name: Marinara Sauce Mix
summary: A simple, kid-friendly sauce that speaks volumes, Marinara is packed with the bright flavour of garlic, oregano, and basil. Pair it with your fave pasta and use it as a base layer for delicious homemade pizza.

products.name: Chicken Souvlaki Seasoning (Pkg of 3)
summary: A Greek-inspired meal, souvlaki is marinated meat grilled on a skewer, often served with warm pita bread and tzatziki. No grill? No problem. Skip the skewers and put your Sheet Pan to work to make equally tasty Chicken Souvlaki in 20 minutes in the oven.

products.name: 1/4 Sheet Pan (Set of 2)
summary: Smaller size than a standard sheet pan for easy handling.
